title: The Fabulous 1950s
description: Test your memory of the Eisenhower era — from sock hops and drive-ins to the birth of rock 'n' roll!

questions.question: Which singer was known as 'The King of Rock and Roll'?
questions.explanation: Elvis Presley earned the title after hits like 'Heartbreak Hotel' and 'Hound Dog' made him the biggest star of the 1950s.

questions.question: What popular 1950s dance involved couples dancing in their socks on a gym floor?
questions.explanation: Sock hops got their name because teens removed their shoes to protect gymnasium floors, dancing in just their socks.

questions.question: Which TV show featured Ricky and Lucy Ricardo?
questions.explanation: I Love Lucy, starring Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz, debuted in 1951 and became one of the most beloved sitcoms in television history.

questions.question: What was the name of the first satellite launched into space in 1957?
questions.explanation: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik on October 4, 1957, shocking the world and kicking off the Space Race.

questions.question: Which U.S. President served throughout most of the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Eisenhower served as the 34th President from 1953 to 1961. He oversaw the construction of the Interstate Highway System.

questions.question: What 1955 James Dean movie became a symbol of teenage rebellion?
questions.explanation: Rebel Without a Cause made James Dean an icon of youthful defiance. Tragically, Dean died in a car crash the same year the film was released.

questions.question: Which rock 'n' roll pioneer recorded 'Johnny B. Goode' in 1958?
questions.explanation: Chuck Berry's 'Johnny B. Goode' is considered one of the most influential rock songs ever recorded and was included on the Voyager Golden Record sent into space.

questions.question: What new type of restaurant became wildly popular in 1950s America, often featuring carhop service?
questions.explanation: Drive-in restaurants boomed in the 1950s, where carhops brought food right to your car window — a perfect match for America's growing car culture.

questions.question: Which TV host's variety show famously introduced Elvis Presley to a massive national audience in 1956?
questions.explanation: Elvis appeared on The Ed Sullivan Show three times in 1956-57. His first appearance drew an estimated 60 million viewers — about 82% of the TV audience.

questions.question: What was the name of the toy that became a massive craze in 1958, with tens of millions sold in just months?
questions.explanation: The Hula Hoop, made by Wham-O, became one of the biggest fads of the decade. Over 25 million were sold in the first four months alone.

questions.question: Which 1950s TV show featured the Cleaver family and their sons Wally and 'The Beaver'?
questions.explanation: Leave It to Beaver aired from 1957 to 1963 and became a defining image of idealized suburban American family life in the 1950s.

questions.question: On February 3, 1959, a plane crash killed Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and which other musician?
questions.explanation: The Big Bopper (J.P. Richardson), known for 'Chantilly Lace,' died alongside Buddy Holly and Ritchie Valens. Don McLean later called it 'The Day the Music Died.'

questions.question: What was the name of the 1954 Supreme Court case that declared racial segregation in public schools unconstitutional?
questions.explanation: Brown v. Board of Education was a landmark decision that overturned 'separate but equal' and became a cornerstone of the Civil Rights Movement.

questions.question: Which actress starred opposite Marlon Brando in 'A Streetcar Named Desire' (1951)?
questions.explanation: Vivien Leigh won her second Academy Award for Best Actress for her portrayal of Blanche DuBois in the film adaptation of Tennessee Williams' play.

questions.question: Which quiz show scandal rocked television in 1958, involving contestant Charles Van Doren?
questions.explanation: The Twenty-One scandal revealed that producers had been feeding answers to contestants. The story was later dramatized in the 1994 Robert Redford film 'Quiz Show.'
